name: Teaching and Learning French Since the 1970s
description: The aim of this course is to present recent research and its classroom applications in relevant contemporary domains of teaching and learning French as a second language, such as French immersion in Canada, including the implications of early, late and partial immersion; recent developments in the teaching of reading and written comprehension; the use of online resources and the pedagogical impact of Information and Communications Technologies in education. [24L]
prerequisites: LTL225Y5/FRE225Y5/FRE272Y5, FRE240H5, FRE241H5 (or FRE240Y5)/FRE280Y5 or a minimum grade of 77% in FSL406H5 or equivalent.
